page.title: 16Farming in World's End
page.content: The farming of the area is mostly arable, with some pastoral. The main crops are barley and corn. Hay-making has become uncommon, as most of the grassland is grazed or cut for silage. However, Common Market prices for cereal crops have meant that it is hardly worth growing such crops as barley. One farm in particular has now turned to pig-farming, which is proving very popular. The farmer nowadays has to be ready and willing to bend to market forces.Recent milk quotas have already caused the disappearance of the cows from the fields. One new crop has appeared;from Germany came Trikkakalee.There are small areas of woodland which are used for timber, and where game pheasants are reared.
